title: Week 1 Day 3 Lesson 4: Loops with the break statement
instructions:

Paste the code below and answer the following questions:
```
# QUESTION 1
# Write code using a while loop that asks the user to enter a number 
# and will run forever until the user enters a number greater than 10.


# QUESTION 2
# The following code will run 100 times, and each time it will ask the user for their name.

while index < 100
  puts "What is your name?"  
  name = gets.chomp
  if name == "Bob"

  end
  index = index + 1

solution:

# Write code using a while loop that asks the user to enter a number

while true
  puts "Enter a number:"
  number = gets.chomp.to_i
  if number > 10
    break
  end
end

# The following code will run 100 times, and each time it will ask the user for their name. 
# The code will break early if the user's name is Bob.
# Rewrite the code using a while loop so the program will run *forever* unless 
# the user enters a name of Bob.

  puts "What is your name?"  
  name = gets.chomp
  if name == "Bob"
    break
  end

# Start with the Person class defined below.

# Add a method called info that returns a string that describes the person's hobbies

  def initialize(first_name, last_name, hair_color, hobbies)
    @first_name = first_name
    @last_name = last_name
    @hair_color = hair_color
    @hobbies = hobbies

    "#{@first_name}.#{@last_name}@gmail.com"
  end

    result = "#{@first_name} #{@last_name}'s hobbies are: "
    index = 0
    while index < @hobbies.length
      result = result + @hobbies[index] + " "
      index = index + 1
    end
    result
  end
end

12 Days of Christmas Pie

This sumptuous holiday delicacy is rarely served in today's "on-the-go, on-demand" society because of the difficulty of not only the procurement of the ingredients, but also because of the difficulty in preparing said ingredients. Traditionally served at Welsh mid-winter feasts, the 12 Days of Christmas Pie will delight the senses and satiate the hunger of the most ardent gourmand.

Ingredients

  • 1 cup partridge, feathers on
  • 2oz turtle dove
  • 3 french hens, quartered, berets included
  • 4 calling birds, preferably muted
  • 5lbs. golden onion rings
  • 6 geese, preferably a-laying eggs
  • 7 whole swans, feathers removed

If you need a good prep knife, I suggest going to Amazon for the best prices.

Hearty Pie Filling

    Steps to preparing the heartiest of pie fillings:
  1. Pre-heat the oven to 350F, and rub butter over the surfaces of the fowl.
  2. Combine the partridge, turtle dove, and onion rings in a food processor until combined.
  3. Place the mixture inside of the french hens.
  4. Stuff the french hens and calling birds into the geese. Expect the geese to protest. Rather vigorously, I should expect.
  5. Tie the swans and stuffed geeese together with twine, and place on a baking sheet. Place the sheet in the oven, on the bottom rack.
  6. Cook for 30min., then flip the bound fowl and cook for another 10min., or until tender.

# QUESTION 1
# Write a method that takes in an array of numbers 
# and returns a count of how many times the number 100 appeared in the array. 
# Then run the method and print the result.
def count_100s(numbers)
  result = 0
  index = 0
  while index < numbers.length
    if numbers[index] == 100
      result = result + 1
    end
    index = index + 1
  end
  result
end
